Done, sorry about that.

Ceres is absolutely awesome. Beautiful design, and beautiful sounds too!

(didn\'t have room to make it mesh nicely with the fairing and have solar panels, I\'ll figure that out for the next mission)

Awesome decoupling sound, I\'ve just flown the Ceres.

Put it in orbit using only your pack, too.

The only problem is, when I opened the chute, it fell off the capsule. Any directions on how to properly use it?

Awesome decoupling sound, I\'ve just flown the Ceres.

Put it in orbit using only your pack, too.

The only problem is, when I opened the chute, it fell off the capsule. Any directions on how to properly use it?

Make sure you\'re below about 140m/s before you open it. It will only fully open at 1000 meters anyway, and by that time you should have decelerated sufficiently.

Just updated and uploaded the new Low Res versions for everything.

They should all be good to go.

Ceres is absolutely awesome. Beautiful design, and beautiful sounds too!

Indeed, this is a fun craft to fly.

Also RCS tank refuses to strap properly. ;P

i have the same problem
And I don\'t. You first need to install the main fuel tank, then stick the RCS tank inside it.
The Ceres is truly an awsome craft. It is very detailed and the sounds are great as well.
This is soon to be the only CSM I use aside from Munar landings.

And I don\'t. You first need to install the main fuel tank, then stick the RCS tank inside it.

ahhhhh thanks!
It\'s a pretty unusual way of doing things, so I think it should be mentioned somewhere near the download link.

The best CSM ever made!

The handling is awesome, the detail is brilliant.

It\'s suitable for almost anything. (Might be the reason for the name )

Thanks, Winston, for making the Ceres MPCV!

OK, there\'s something I\'d like to request. Interstage adapters fairings.

Currently, the only complete set of adapters available is NovaPunch pack. I\'ve found your interstages better, but your pack doesn\'t include any adapters.

Things are especially bad on 3m adapters, there\'s precisely one 2 to 3m adapter fairing (in NP pack, of course) and it\'s rather wobbly, not to mention doesn\'t always fit.

Same goes for 3 to 2m, but those aren\'t as useful.

So, could you make a set of adapter interstages for your pack?

I think because of your unorthodox positioning of the RCS tank in respect to the stack, it is causing it to be preferentially drained before any other RCS tank. As a result I find this pod extremely difficult to get into orbit since I can\'t use RCS on the launching rocket. I wonder if you could use this new part scripting to make a service module part, that acts as a normal fuel tank, RCS fuel tank and ASAS combined?
I downloaded the Challenger LEM pack by itself and it seems that a 'parachuteTriple' is missing, do I have to download the main pack also?
Dood this the best pack i have ever seen good job
